questions.question: Which of the following correctly describe current density in an electrochemical reactor?

answers.a: It is the electric current per unit area of the electrode surface
answers.b: It influences the rate of electrochemical reactions
answers.c: High current density can cause side reactions and electrode corrosion
answers.d: Low current density can result in lower productivity but higher energy efficiency

explanations.a: Correct. Current density is defined as electric current per electrode surface area.
explanations.b: Correct. Reaction rates depend strongly on current density.
explanations.c: Correct. Excessive current density can lead to side reactions and damage.
explanations.d: Correct. Lower current density typically reduces productivity but improves efficiency.

questions.question: Why is increasing the electrode area beneficial in an electrochemical reactor?

answers.a: It provides more active sites for redox reactions
answers.b: It enables higher total current without increasing current density
answers.d: It allows scaling the reactor for industrial applications

explanations.a: Correct. Larger area means more sites for reactions.
explanations.b: Correct. More surface area can handle more current with less stress.
explanations.c: Correct. Uniform reaction distribution is improved with larger electrodes.
explanations.d: Correct. Industrial scale reactors use larger electrode areas.

questions.question: Which effects are caused by electrolyte concentration changes in an electrochemical reactor?

answers.c: Low concentration causes poor conductivity and voltage losses
answers.d: Electrolyte concentration directly affects reaction rates

explanations.a: Correct. More ions reduce solution resistance.
explanations.b: Correct. Higher concentration improves ionic movement.
explanations.c: Correct. Insufficient ions increase losses and slow reactions.
explanations.d: Correct. Charge transport affects reaction kinetics.

questions.question: What are the consequences of temperature variations in an electrochemical reactor?

answers.c: Excessive temperature may damage electrodes and electrolyte
answers.d: Temperature must be controlled for reactor integrity and efficiency

explanations.b: Correct. Reactions proceed faster at higher temperature.
explanations.c: Correct. Too high temperature causes damage and side reactions.
explanations.d: Correct. Maintaining optimal temperature is critical.

questions.question: How are the key parameters in an electrochemical reactor interrelated?

answers.a: Current density depends on total current and electrode area
answers.b: Electrolyte concentration affects electrical conductivity and reaction kinetics
answers.c: Temperature influences electrode stability and electrolyte behavior
answers.d: All parameters must be balanced for optimal reactor performance

explanations.a: Correct. Current density is current divided by electrode area.
explanations.b: Correct. Concentration impacts ion transport and reactions.
explanations.c: Correct. Temperature affects both electrodes and electrolyte properties.
explanations.d: Correct. The parameters are interconnected and must be balanced.
